posts.title: Walmart and P&G Partner For New Recycling Program
posts.content:
Walmart and P & G have a new collaboration with international recycling leader TerraCycle inviting shoppers to drop off traditionally non-recyclable beauty waste. 

  • Partnered: The collaboration increases the initiative to provide locations for consumers to recycle traditionally non-recyclable items. The new Walmart Beauty Free Recycling Program provides store drop-off points for haircare, skincare, and cosmetic packaging — things that aren’t accepted curbside. 
  • Go to: Drop-off locations in NWA are at the Walmart on MLK Blvd in Fayetteville, Mall Ave in Fayetteville, Pleasant Crossing in Rogers, Walnut St in Rogers, Walton Blvd in Bentonville, and Highway 412 in Siloam Springs. 

Click HERE for more information.

posts.title: Surprise Pop-Up Bar Open At Theatre Squared
posts.content:
A Surprise Pop-Up bar opened on the TheatreSquared rooftop terrace yesterday featuring "post-apocalyptic-1950s-retro-southwest-sci-fi" themed cocktails! 

  • Drinks: The pop-up bar is called Area 52 and has extremely limited first-come, first-served seating from 6-10p Thursday-Saturday, open to all members of the public. Three cocktails are on offer by Washington Post "Best "bartender" Adam "Bernbach, including one brand new recipe. Popcorn and other movie-themed snacks are also available. 
  • Stage: Area 52 features quirky installations and near-life-sized aliens. In a room adjacent to the bar on September 10, the 1953 cult sci-fi classic It Came From Outer Space will play on a loop to allow visitors to see the movie upon which the stage adaptation is based. 

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • AcreTrader is looking for a Investment Analyst
  • SVI has a position open for a Senior Graphic Designer

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

posts.title: Ozarktober Schedule Released
posts.content:
Downtown Springdale has announced its line-up of events for Ozarktober 2022! 

  • Celebrate: Ozarktober is a celebration of fall in the Ozarks and is held during October in downtown Springdale. This year, many events will take place outdoors and in the Outdoor Dining District from October 8-30. 
  • Fall fun: Events include live music and local brews, artist showcases, a multi-course brunch on a train, a haunted train, a bonfire, and more! Tickets for the events range from $0-$100 and are on sale now. 

Click HERE for more information.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Labor Day weekend!! We hope you get some well-earned rest. Here are a few things happening around NWA you might be interested in checking out:

  • Woo Pig: Arkansas Football begins tomorrow! Head over to HogTown before the game for a good time. 
  • Block party: Kick-off Art & Culinary week in Bentonville at First Friday. 
  • Run: The 11th Annual Trifest for MS starts today, and you can register here!
  • Lights: Check out the new interactive exhibit on the Crystal Bridges grounds this weekend. 
  • Ride: Don’t miss the Amped Electric Games in Bentonville all weekend. 

Have a wonderful weekend! Stay safe, and we'll see you next week!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Lovely land: Check out Mount Olive Farms in Gravette to pick your own flowers, host an event, or stay on the farm!*
  • Art city: CACHE released its September events schedule. 
  • Funds: NWA is getting $12 million to repair storm-damaged roads and bridges. 
  • Go see: Need reasons to visit Bentonville? Here are five great ones. 
  • Roads: Maple Street in Fayetteville will be closed for the first Razorback game. 
  • Put it out there: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
